data: {"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3320355,"name":"Marshall Bartz Schneider","username":"Marstoo","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/m/c6cbf5/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-02-29T05:43:46.599Z","cooked":"\u003cp\u003eHi, my team uses one chain on each side of the shooter to help it pivot, but were are having an issue where we can never get both chains tensioned at the same time. We can tension either side, but then the other side is always too loose. Does anyone know what the problem could be?\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eEdit: I hope we will be able to get the chains to tension with the AndyMark tensions we have bought, but, in case we can’t, does anyone know if/where we can buy \u003cspan class=\"hashtag-raw\"\u003e#35\u003c/span\u003e inline chain tensions of different lengths?\u003c/p\u003e","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2024-02-29T06:16:53.634Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":13,"reads":203,"readers_count":202,"score":105.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":456644,"topic_slug":"two-chain-tensioners-on-shooter-pivot-only-one-works-at-a-time","display_username":"Marshall Bartz Schneider","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":64665,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/two-chain-tensioners-on-shooter-pivot-only-one-works-at-a-time/456644/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3320356,"name":"Nick Foote","username":"Footie","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/footie/{size}/218325_2.png","created_at":"2024-02-29T05:47:04.264Z","cooked":"\u003cp\u003eWhat is your chain tensioning mechanism? Are the sides separate from each other, or linked where both are tensioned at the same time with a linked mechanism? Can we see a photo?\u003c/p\u003e","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2024-02-29T05:48:10.322Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":201,"readers_count":200,"score":45.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":456644,"topic_slug":"two-chain-tensioners-on-shooter-pivot-only-one-works-at-a-time","display_username":"Nick Foote","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":8103,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Nick Foote - 2102 Team Paradox - Engineering Mentor and Founding Student"},"post_url":"/t/two-chain-tensioners-on-shooter-pivot-only-one-works-at-a-time/456644/2","custom_user_title":"Nick Foote - 2102 Team Paradox - Engineering Mentor and Founding Student","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3320366,"name":"Marshall Bartz Schneider","username":"Marstoo","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/m/c6cbf5/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-02-29T06:06:26.033Z","cooked":"\u003cp\u003eThanks for asking for clarification! We have a hex shaft in the belly of our robot driven by a neo with a 90-degree gearbox. On the top of the robot (the pivot for the shooter), we have a SplineXL. On both ends of the hex shaft and Spline XL, we have a gear. We have two separate chains. A chain runs on both sides to connect the gear on the SplineXL to the gear on the hex shaft. I believe we are using \u003cspan class=\"hashtag-raw\"\u003e#35\u003c/span\u003e inline chain tensioners from AndyMark.\u003c/p\u003e","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2024-02-29T06:06:26.033Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":183,"readers_count":182,"score":41.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":456644,"topic_slug":"two-chain-tensioners-on-shooter-pivot-only-one-works-at-a-time","display_username":"Marshall Bartz Schneider","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":8103,"username":"Footie","name":"Nick Foote","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/footie/{size}/218325_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":64665,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/two-chain-tensioners-on-shooter-pivot-only-one-works-at-a-time/456644/3","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3320367,"name":"Christopher149","username":"Christopher149","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/c/838e76/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-02-29T06:08:06.440Z","cooked":"\u003cp\u003eSomething I would check is to match sure the teeth on your sprockets are clocked to the same position on each side, and that each chain has the same number of links. Don’t know if that would cause this issue, but seems like a good idea regardless.\u003c/p\u003e","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2024-02-29T06:08:06.440Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":170,"readers_count":169,"score":54.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":456644,"topic_slug":"two-chain-tensioners-on-shooter-pivot-only-one-works-at-a-time","display_username":"Christopher149","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":14984,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"FRC857 lead mentor / FTC10723+13284+15270 lead mentor"},"post_url":"/t/two-chain-tensioners-on-shooter-pivot-only-one-works-at-a-time/456644/4","custom_user_title":"FRC857 lead mentor / FTC10723+13284+15270 lead mentor","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3320369,"name":"Marshall Bartz Schneider","username":"Marstoo","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/m/c6cbf5/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-02-29T06:13:30.238Z","cooked":"\u003cp\u003eWe lined up the clocking of the sprockets today, and we still couldn’t get the chains to tension at the same time. We’ll make sure to check the length of the chains tomorrow. Thanks!\u003c/p\u003e","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2024-02-29T06:13:30.238Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":4,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":166,"readers_count":165,"score":33.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":456644,"topic_slug":"two-chain-tensioners-on-shooter-pivot-only-one-works-at-a-time","display_username":"Marshall Bartz Schneider","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":14984,"username":"Christopher149","name":"Christopher149","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/c/838e76/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":64665,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/two-chain-tensioners-on-shooter-pivot-only-one-works-at-a-time/456644/5","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3320375,"name":"NathanNFM","username":"NathanNFM","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/nathannfm/{size}/181060_2.png","created_at":"2024-02-29T06:22:43.997Z","cooked":"\u003cp\u003eIf they are clocked the same this shouldn’t be necessary, but if you have room for a tensioner on either side of the run (so with 2 chain loops, that’s 4 total tensioners) you should be able to get all the slack out, but again, if they are clocked that shouldn’t be an issue. With hex shaft it’s hard to get every last bit of slop out, so you can also try to preload the shooter so the motor is always pulling against the preload. My team is using \u003ca href=\"https://www.andymark.com/products/1-8-in-id-3-8-in-od-black-surgical-tubing\"\u003esurgical tubing\u003c/a\u003e for this to pull the shooter down. When the robot aims the motor is always stretching the tubing which keeps it from bouncing around.\u003c/p\u003e","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2024-02-29T06:22:43.997Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":148,"readers_count":147,"score":34.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":456644,"topic_slug":"two-chain-tensioners-on-shooter-pivot-only-one-works-at-a-time","display_username":"NathanNFM","primary_group_name":"AndyMark","flair_name":"AndyMark","flair_url":"/uploads/default/original/3X/7/2/72db24f824a25ae17c6413b3d02a345e47f060a9.png","flair_bg_color":"","flair_color":"","flair_group_id":59,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.andymark.com/products/1-8-in-id-3-8-in-od-black-surgical-tubing","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"1/8 in. ID 3/8 in. OD Black Surgical Tubing - AndyMark, Inc","clicks":4}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":14566,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"AndyMark Senior Mechanical Engineer"},"post_url":"/t/two-chain-tensioners-on-shooter-pivot-only-one-works-at-a-time/456644/6","custom_user_title":"AndyMark Senior Mechanical Engineer","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3320377,"name":"Nick Foote","username":"Footie","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/footie/{size}/218325_2.png","created_at":"2024-02-29T06:23:14.745Z","cooked":"\u003cp\u003eWith tensioners like that, you \u003cem\u003eshould\u003c/em\u003e be able to get pretty close to equal. Let me ask you this? Did you just recently put the chain on, or only just start running it? Like, the last day or so? Because you should expect chain to stretch for a little while before it gets to it’s fully stretched length, and you’ll need to keep tensioning until it settles.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eThey’re never going to be perfectly equal, one chain is always going to be doing more of the work, and that chain is then going to stretch, and then the other one will take the load, and then it will stretch, passing the work back and forth over the course of days. You’re likely going to have to keep tweaking the tension while you run it, and eventually it’ll stop stretching (depends on how much you run it and how long the chain is).\u003c/p\u003e","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2024-02-29T06:23:14.745Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":139,"readers_count":138,"score":47.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":456644,"topic_slug":"two-chain-tensioners-on-shooter-pivot-only-one-works-at-a-time","display_username":"Nick Foote","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":64665,"username":"Marstoo","name":"Marshall Bartz Schneider","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/m/c6cbf5/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":8103,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Nick Foote -
